Chapter.P: Introduction
This guide documents how to install and upgrade MiramoPDF and the DITA-OT plugin.
MiramoPDF should always be installed or upgraded before the DITA-OT plugin.
Downloading
This document describes how to download Miramo and the MiramoPDF DITA-OT plugin ready for installation on Windows, Linux and MacOSX.
Download the platform specific installation package from http://www.miramo.com/pdownload/splogin.php

URL: http://www.miramo.com/pdownload/splogin.php
Complete the form with your company, contact name
and email address, together with the username, password
and filename below:
Username: mdownload
Password: summertime
Filename: see below
Enter the appropriate platform specific installation package filenames as follows:
Miramo installation packages

Chapter.P: Installing Miramo
Windows installation
This section includes information on system requirements and installation for the MiramoPDF desktop version.
Installing MiramoPDF Desktop

Double-click on the MiramoPDF2.0.0pNNNsetup.exe to install MiramoPDF. When prompted, navigate to your chosen installation folder (default is C:\Program Files\Miramo\MiramoPDF2.0.0 and click on OK to continue.
If an earlier version of MiramoPDF is already installed, you will be prompted as shown below:
Click on Yes to uninstall the previous version (recommended), or click on No to proceed without uninstalling the previous version.
Choosing default options will create the following folder:
The MiramoDesigner 2.0.0 desktop shortcut will be updated to point to MiramoDesigner.exe in this folder, and the miramo.exe binary (composition engine) is located in the same folder.

The PATH environment variable will be set as shown here. Note that if you chose not to uninstall the previous version, both the earlier version and 2.0.0 install folders are included in the PATH environment variable, but the earlier version (1.6 in the example shown) takes precedence.

If you wish to install multiple concurrent versions of the composition engine, and are publishing using the MiramoPDF DITA-OT plugin, the location of the miramo.exe binary may be configured using the miramopath ant build parameter.
Linux installation
This document describes how to install the Linux version of Miramo for server or desktop use.
Log in to the target server as an admin user and follow the steps below:

ParaGroup.P:
Create a new folder if necessary, eg /opt/miramo:
mkdir -p /opt/miramo

Change directory to the new folder:
cd /opt/miramo

Extract files from the downloaded distribution package, for example:
tar -xzof /tmp/MiramoPDF-DBD-2.0.0pNNN.tar.gz to create /opt/miramo/MiramoPDF-2.0.0pNNN - this is the Miramo installation folder.

Change directory to the installation folder, eg:
cd /opt/miramo/MiramoPDF-2.0.0pNNN

Run the install.sh script:
./install.sh

Chapter.P:
The install.sh script runs the ’installComposer.sh’ script which does the following:
installs the fontconfig prerequisite if necessary
makes a link from /usr/local/bin/miramo and /usr/local/bin/miramo-2.0.0 to the runComposer.sh wrapper script located in the installation folder, so the miramo and miramo-2.0.0 commands (composition engine) are automatically available to all users.

For Linux RHD and DBD distributions, the install.sh script also installs MiramoDesigner using the installDesigner.sh script, and makes it available to the desktop manager via /usr/share/applications/miramo-designer.desktop

If you wish to install multiple concurrent versions of the composition engine, and are publishing using the MiramoPDF DITA-OT plugin, the location of the runMmComposer.sh script may be configured using the ’miramopath’ ant build parameter.
MacOSX installation

ParaGroup.P: Locate the downloaded .pkg and right-click to 'Open', or double click on the .pkg from your browser:
The package is not notorized so the following notifications will show, dismiss them both:
To address this click the apple icon, click system preferences and choose 'security & privacy' - click on 'Open Anyway':

Chapter.P: Upgrading Miramo
To upgrade Miramo, first uninstall as described below then install the new version according to the instructions given in
Upgrading Miramo
To upgrade Miramo, first uninstall as described below then install the new version according to the instructions given in
Windows uninstall

ParaGroup.P: Uninstall MiramoPDF or MiramoEnterprise via the Add/Remove Programs control panel.
Reboot the system
Remove any remaining installation files from C:\Program Files\Miramo and/or C:\Program Files (x86)\miramo

Chapter.P: Linux uninstall

Log in as the administrator user (root) and uninstall Miramo as follows:
Remove the current /opt/miramo-n.n.n folder
Remove symbolic links /usr/local/bin/miramo and /usr/local/bin/miramo-n.n.n
For Linux RHD and DBD distributions, remove the /usr/share/applications/miramo-designer.desktop folder
Installing the DITA-OT plugin

The MiramoPDF DITA-OT plugin com.miramo.mmpdf is designed to be seamlessly integrated with any CMS or XML authoring tool such as oXygen or XMetaL. Alternatively it may be used with a standalone DITA-OT installation via the command line interface. This chapter gives an overview of installing or upgrading the plugin.
System requirements
Before installing the Miramo DITA-OT plugin the following software must be installed and working on the target system:

ParaGroup.P: DITA-OT version 2.4 or above
MiramoPDF or Miramo Enterprise vs 2.0 or above

Chapter.P: MiramoPDF Personal edition runs on the following operating systems:

ParaGroup.P: Windows 7 Professional (64 bit only)
Windows 8.1 (64 bit only)
Windows 10

Chapter.P: Miramo Enterprise is available to run on Windows Server and Linux operating systems - contact us for more information.
Installing the Miramo DITA-OT plugin for the first time
These instructions relate to installing and integrating the Miramo DITA-OT plugin into an existing DITA-OT installation folder for the first time. For information on upgrading the plugin see .
To integrate with your XML authoring tool or DITA CMS, follow the instructions given by your vendor. See Appendices for information on and .
See for a list of files and folders installed in the DITA-OT plugins/ com.miramo.mmpdf folder.
Installing from the setup.exe [Windows only]

Double-click on the MiramoDITA-OTplugin<vs>setup.exe and navigate to the DITA-OT install root folder, which contains the 'integrator.xml' file. The MiramoDITA-OT plugin source (including samples, command scripts and templates) will be located in the [dita-ot install dir]/ plugins/com.miramo.mmpdf folder, for example:
The MiramoDITA-OTplugin<vs>setup.exe will run the DITA-OT integrator and will append the com.miramo.mmpdf folder to the PATH environment variable. The plugin is now ready to use.
See www.dita-ot.org for more information on installing and integrating DITA-OT plugins.
Installing from ZIP archive [all platforms]

Download the Miramo DITA-OT plugin ZIP file from www.miramo.com into a temporary folder tmpdir, then run the 'dita -install MiramoDITA-OTplugin<vs>.zip' command to install and register the plugin with the DITA-OT, for example:

cd tmpdir
dita-ot-installdir/bin/dita -install MiramoDITA-OTplugin200p01.zip

This will create a new folder,
dita-ot-installdir/plugins/com.miramo.mmpdf
See www.dita-ot.org for more information on installing and integrating DITA-OT plugins.
Files and folders
The com.miramo.mmpdf plugin includes the following files and folders, located in the DITA-OT installation folder selected during installation:
Source for com.miramo.mmpdf plugin:
cfg/

XSL stylesheet placeholders and language specific localization strings. Do not change the contents of this folder - see for information on generating a custom plugin based on com.miramo.mmpdf and mmpdf:localization-strings.dir
com.example.my-mmpdf/
Contains source files for making a specialization of the com.miramo.mmpdf plugin. See for more details.
docs/Miramo_DITA-OT_GettingStarted.pdf
This document
images/
Images used by the com.miramo.mmpdf plugin
integration/oxygen/MiramoPDF.scenarios
The oXygen transformation scenario for producing a PDF from the currently edited DITA file. Import into your oXygen tool using Options->import transformations
integration/xmetal/*
Files needed for integrating with XMetaL.
logos/
Images and logos used by the com.miramo.mmpdf plugin
mmtemplates/
Miramo Format Definitions default template for DITA publishing:
Miramo Format Definitions templates are XML files which can be edited using the MiramoPDF GUI template design tool, MiramoDesigner.
default template used for publishing DITA content out of the box
samples/flowers/
The oXygen DITA flowers sample
samples/taskbook/
A modified version of the DITA-OT taskbook (IT book) sample
xsl
XSL stylesheets for mapping DITA to MiramoXML
dita2mm.cmd
Command script for preprocessing a DITA input file to MiramoXML, ready for rendering to PDF. Called by:
dita2mmpdf.cmd
Command script for running the flowers demo, or for producing a PDF from a specified DITA map.
build_dita2mmpdf.xml

XML file which contains the ant targets for performing topicmerge and translating the DITA content to MiramoXML (Miramo Simple Markup, which represents the document content), and for rendering that document content to PDF using the format definitions in the MFD template.
Upgrading
Upgrading the Miramo DITA-OT plugin

Double-click on the MiramoDITA-OTplugin<vs>setup.exe and navigate to the DITA-OT install root folder. If the target DITA-OT folder already contains an instance of the Miramo DITA-OT plugin com.miramo.mmpdf, the installer will automatically uninstall the existing plugin from the com.miramo.mmpdf plugin folder, and existing configuration files and XSL stylesheets in the com.miramo.mmpdf folder will be overwritten. If you wish to install multiple versions of the plugin, navigate to a different DITA-OT folder and choose to proceed without uninstalling the previous version when prompted.

If you have made changes to the 'default.mfd' template file located in the com.miramo.mmpdf\mmtemplates folder, the installer will make a backup copy of the 'default.mfd' to 'default-pre<vs>mfd', where <vs> is the version being installed for example 200p01. Any other MFD files located in the mmtemplates folder will be left unchanged.
ImportantOnce the installation has completed, upgrade any existing MFD files (including the renamed 'default.mfd' if present) by following the instructions given below.
Upgrading existing MFD files
Several new features and improvements have been introduced in version 2.0 of the MiramoPDF DITA-OT plugin, some of which have implications for upgrading existing MFD template files.

For example, the interparagraph spacing mode has changed since version 1.4 to remove inconsistencies. In the new version, spacing between paragraphs is exclusively controlled using @spaceAbove and @spaceBelow. If the values of these attributes is 0, there will be no space between paragraphs.

If you are using oXygen, a new transformation scenario 'MiramoPDF 2.0.0 MFD upgrade' has been added to streamline the upgrade process. See for more information. Alternatively the MiramoPDF distribution includes a command line utility 'mfdupgrade.cmd' which automates the upgrade process.

Running the automated upgrade process on an MFD file 'filename.mfd' results in a new MFD file 'filename_upgraded.mfd'. Once you are happy with the results of the upgrade, this may be used in place of the original MFD file (but it is recommended that you make a backup copy first).
Upgrading oXygen Transformation scenarios
Before importing the transformation scenarios, open the Transformation Scenarios window and ensure that the Show all scenarios is set:
Import the 'MiramoPDF.scenarios' from the <dita-ot>plugins/com.miramo.mmpdf/integration/oxygen folder (see for more information).
Using the oXygen 'MiramoPDF MFD upgrade' transformation
To use the MiramoPDF 2.0.0 MFD upgrade scenario:

ParaGroup.P: open the target MFD template as an XML file in oXygen editor
apply the MiramoPDF 2.0.0 MFD upgrade transformation

Chapter.P: This creates a new MFD file 'template_upgraded.mfd' and opens it using MiramoDesigner. The console window will display diagnostic information describing the changes made.
Using the 'mfdupgrade' command line tool
The 'mfdupgrade.cmd' script is installed in c:\program files\Miramo\MiramoPDF which is added to the PATH environment variable by the installer.
To upgrade your MFD file, start a new DOS command window and enter the following commands:

cd "foldercontainingMFDfile"
mfdupgrade template.mfd
The system will produce a log file 'mfdupgrade.log' in the current folder, and will automatically open the new template_upgraded.mfd using MiramoDesigner.

The MM_DITA_DIR environment variable is set to the location of the com.miramo.mmpdf plugin folder during installation of the DITA-OT plugin. The mfdupgrade utility copies any missing or updated Format Definitions from the DITA-OT plugin default template 'default.mfd' located in %MM_DITA_DIR%/plugins/ com.miramo.mmpdf/mmtemplates.
